subject: Re: [junit] Test Case Results segregation
msgSnippet: ... I don t understand different versions of test suites . If you mean different versions of the same class, then you can t run those tests simultaneously,
messageBody:
ramandeep340 wrote:
>
>
> Hello,
>
> I would like to know if there is a mechanism to segregate
> test case results based on some version. e.g I have test
> functions which were added in different versions of test
> suite, can I segregate the results based on these versions.

I don't understand "different versions of test suites". If you mean
different versions of the same class, then you can't run those tests
simultaneously, anyway. Tell us more about what, in general, you're
trying to do.

You can always use XSLT or XML parsing to analyze the test results that
Ant generates with the <junit> task.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
